go_data.justification: Interferon-beta is induced in response to viral infection and plays a key role in the anti-viral innate immune response.
Interferon-beta expression is triggered by the detection of viral DNA and RNA by cellular pattern recognition receptors.
Interferon-beta acts in an autocrine and paracrine manner to induce the expression of target genes that contribute to anti-viral innate immunity.
Interferon-beta is a cytokine that promotes anti-viral innate immunity and adaptive immune responses.
